quotes.quote: The safe way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
Be saving, but not at the cost of all liberality. Have the soul of a king and the hand of a wise economist.
Look everywhere you can to cut a little bit from your expenses. It will all add up to a meaningful sum.
The quickest way to double your money is to fold it in half and put it in your back pocket.
A budget is telling your money where to go instead of wondering where it went.
You must learn to save first and spend afterwards.
Balancing your money is the key to having enough.
Saving must become a priority, not just a thought. Pay yourself first.
The habit of saving is itself an education; it fosters every virtue, teaches self-denial, cultivates the sense of order, trains to forethought, and so broadens the mind.
Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it, and others do just the same with their time.
It's good to have money and the things that money can buy, but it's good, too, to check up once in a while and make sure that you haven't lost the things that money can't buy.
By definition, saving for anything requires us to not get things now so that we can get bigger ones later.
The art is not in making money, but in keeping it.
He who will not economize will have to agonize.
The easiest way to save money is to waste less energy.
A simple fact that is hard to learn is that the time to save money is when you have some.
Saving is a very fine thing. Especially when your parents have done it for you.
Money looks better in the bank than on your feet.
It's not how much money you make, but how much money you keep, how hard it works for you, and how many generations you keep it for.
Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
If we command our wealth, we shall be rich and free. If our wealth commands us, we are poor indeed.
When a man has learned to live without money, he thought, a few rubles can go a long way.
Spend not where you may save; spare not where you must spend.
Save a little money each month and at the end of the year you'll be surprised at how little you have.
Money has never made man happy, nor will it, there is nothing in its nature to produce happiness. The more of it one has the more one wants.
A man is usually more careful of his money than he is of his principles.
If you can count your money, you don't have a billion dollars.
There is a gigantic difference between earning a great deal of money and being rich.
If you wish to get rich, save what you get. A fool can earn money; but it takes a wise man to save and dispose of it to his own advantage.
Saving requires us to not get things now so that we can get bigger ones later.
